refbody.section: PurposeCreate an operating system command shell to run arbitrary commands.THIS COMMAND SHOULD NOT BE AVAILABLE IN FIRMWARE SHIPPED TO EXTERNAL CUSTOMERS.

ul.li: The busybox shell bundles numerous Linux utilities into a single executable. See busybox. You can also call any other binary executable in the operating system.
Use the exit command or the end-of-file character ctrl-D to return to the command line interface (CLI).

refbody.section: ExampleEnter the busybox shell and then return to the command line interface (CLI).Console> busybox # ls /home/admin # exit Console>

Information for consumers onlyThis command is a hidden command, meant for internal use only. As such, it is included only in development-keyed firmware. It must not be revealed or made accessible to end customers. Reference to this command must be removed before publishing this documentation to end customers. It is present for pre-GA development use only.
